modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the provided examples:

- Incorrect HTML: <a href="https://www.intapp.com/firms/seyfarth-shaw/" id="firms_seyfarth-shaw">
- Corrected HTML: <a href="https://www.intapp.com/firms/seyfarth-shaw/" id="firms_seyfarth-shaw" title="Seyfarth Shaw">

Explanation:
To fix the accessibility issue, a `title` attribute has been added to the anchor tag. The `title` attribute provides accessible text for screen readers and assistive technologies when the link itself doesn't contain any visible text.

In this case, the `title` attribute is set to "Seyfarth Shaw", which describes the purpose or destination of the link. This ensures that users relying on assistive technologies can understand the purpose of the link even if there is no visible text within the anchor tag.

By adding the `title` attribute, the link becomes accessible and complies with the WCAG 2.1 guidelines.

In this case, the title "The Riverside Company" describes the purpose or destination of the link.

By adding the `title` attribute, we ensure that the link has accessible text, even if there is no visible text content within the anchor tag itself.
